painPoints.conclusion: Dejalos seguir creyendo que estan organizados.

roiCalculator.title: Calcula Tus Costos Ocultos en Menos de 60 Segundos

safeWorkPractices.title: Safe Work Practices
safeWorkPractices.templatesDescription: Pre-built templates covering essential safety topics for rope access operations
safeWorkPractices.templateNoticeText: These are template Safe Work Practices. Review and customize them to match your specific company policies and operational requirements. Ensure all employees are trained and acknowledge these practices before work commences.

ppe.title: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
ppe.description: Guidelines for proper selection, use, and maintenance of personal protective equipment in rope access operations.
principles: PPE is the last line of defense - engineering controls come first
All PPE must be inspected before each use
PPE must be appropriate for the specific hazard
Damaged or expired PPE must be immediately replaced
Workers must be trained in proper PPE use

fallProtection.title: Fall Protection
fallProtection.description: Essential practices for preventing falls from height during rope access operations.
principles: Falls from height are the leading cause of fatalities in construction
Dual rope systems provide redundancy for safety
Anchor points must be independently tested and certified
100% tie-off is required when working at height
Fall arrest equipment must limit free fall to 6 feet or less

manualHandling.title: Manual Handling
manualHandling.description: Safe practices for lifting, carrying, and moving materials during work operations.
principles: Back injuries are often preventable with proper technique
Use mechanical aids whenever possible
Team lifts for loads over 25kg
Plan the lift before attempting
Keep loads close to your body

heatCold.title: Heat and Cold Stress Prevention
heatCold.description: Managing environmental temperature extremes to protect worker health and safety.
principles: Both heat and cold can cause serious medical emergencies
Acclimatization takes time - build up exposure gradually
Hydration is critical in both hot and cold environments
Recognize early warning signs of heat/cold stress
Implement work-rest cycles in extreme conditions

chemical.title: Chemical Safety
chemical.description: Safe handling, storage, and use of cleaning chemicals and hazardous substances.
principles: All chemicals can be hazardous if misused
Safety Data Sheets (SDS) contain critical safety information
Never mix chemicals unless specifically authorized
Use appropriate PPE when handling chemicals
Store chemicals according to compatibility requirements

toolEquipment.title: Tool and Equipment Safety
toolEquipment.description: Safe practices for using hand tools, power tools, and equipment at height.
principles: Tools can become deadly projectiles if dropped from height
All tools must be tethered when working at height
Power tools require additional safety precautions
Inspect tools before each use
Use the right tool for the job

electrical.title: Electrical Safety
electrical.description: Preventing electrical hazards and injuries during rope access work.
principles: Electricity can kill instantly
Maintain safe clearances from power lines
Use GFCI protection for all power tools
Never work on live electrical systems
Report any electrical hazards immediately

emergency.title: Emergency Response
emergency.description: Procedures for responding to emergencies and rescue situations.
principles: Every worker must know emergency procedures
Communication is critical in emergencies
Rescue plans must be in place before work begins
First aid supplies must be readily accessible
Practice emergency drills regularly

hero.title: When the Auditor Shows Up,
hero.subtitle: Will You Be Scrambling or Ready?
hero.descriptionStrong: Build compliance records that protect your business when it matters most.

problem.title: El archivo que nunca encuentras
problem.paragraph1: Los certificados de seguro estan en el correo electronico. Los registros de reuniones de seguridad estan en una carpeta en el camion. Los certificados de arnes estan... en algun lugar.
problem.paragraph2: Cuando un administrador de propiedad pide prueba de seguro antes de que puedas comenzar, te apresuras. Cuando un auditor quiere seis meses de registros de reuniones de seguridad, excavas durante horas.
problem.paragraph3: OnRopePro mantiene todo en un solo lugar. Sube una vez. Busca cuando lo necesites. Exporta para cualquier solicitud.
problem.intro: You handed your new hire the safety manual. He said "yep, I read it" and set it aside.
problem.scenario: Two weeks later, he causes damage during a window cleaning job because he used a technique from his old company. Now you're facing a claim, and "he told me he read it" is your entire defense.
problem.reality: Paper systems don't fail during normal operations. They fail during audits, lawsuits, and insurance investigations. The moment you need to prove compliance, you discover scattered files, missing signatures, and no way to verify who actually reviewed what.
problem.solution: OnRopePro treats document management as the foundation of your liability protection. Every acknowledgment is timestamped. Every signature is permanent. When WorkSafeBC asks for proof, you don't search. You generate a report.

signature.description: When employees review documents, they sign digitally with a captured timestamp. No more "I didn't know" excuses. The signature proves they saw the exact version you uploaded, on the exact date and time.

compliance.title: Compliance Status Tracking
compliance.description: See exactly who has signed which documents, who has gaps, and who needs reminders. Dashboards show missing acknowledgments before they become audit findings.

audit.title: Instant Audit Response
audit.description: Generate compliance reports in seconds. When regulators, insurers, or attorneys ask for documentation, you provide professional reports instead of paper shuffling.

technicians.problem1Title: "I Don't Know What Procedures Apply Here"
technicians.problem1Desc: Every company has different procedures. Your previous employer did anchoring differently. You want to follow the rules, but you're not sure which version is current or whether you've seen everything you're supposed to see.
technicians.solution1: Your document list clearly shows what requires your acknowledgment. Previously signed documents display the acknowledgment date. New versions trigger re-acknowledgment requirements. You always know where you stand.

companyOwners.title: For Company Owners
companyOwners.problem1Title: "We Got Sued and I Can't Prove He Was Trained"
companyOwners.problem1Desc: Your technician damaged an anchor point. The building manager is claiming negligence. You know your guy was trained on proper anchoring, but the only proof is a sign-in sheet from a safety meeting 18 months ago, and you can't find it. Your lawyer says the case hinges on documentation you can't produce.
companyOwners.solution1: Every document acknowledgment is timestamped and digitally signed. When legal questions arise, you generate a report showing exactly which procedures the employee reviewed and when. Your defense is a PDF, not a memory.
companyOwners.problem2Title: "Our Insurance Was Declined Because of Missing Docs"
companyOwners.problem2Desc: Your Certificate of Insurance expired three weeks ago. You didn't notice until the building manager blocked site access. You scramble to get renewed coverage, but the gap in insurance creates liability exposure you didn't know you had.
companyOwners.solution2: Insurance document expiration tracking sends advance warnings. Dashboard alerts flag COI renewal deadlines before they become site access problems. You renew proactively instead of reactively.

opsManagers.title: For Operations Managers
opsManagers.problem1Title: "I Have No Idea Who Has Actually Read Our Procedures"
opsManagers.problem1Desc: You have a safety manual. You're pretty sure most employees have seen it. When the auditor asks for proof that each employee acknowledged your fall protection procedures, you realize "pretty sure" isn't documentation. Your new hire three weeks ago never signed anything.
opsManagers.solution1: Track acknowledgment status for every employee against every document. Instantly see who has signed which procedures and who has gaps. New hires cannot start work until they acknowledge all required documents.
opsManagers.problem2Desc: You updated the toolbox meeting procedure last month. Some employees signed the new version, some haven't seen it yet, and you have no visibility into the gap. When the next audit happens, you discover 5 employees never acknowledged the updated procedure.
opsManagers.solution2: Compliance status reporting shows exactly which employees have missing acknowledgments. Dashboard alerts highlight gaps before they become audit findings.

buildingManagers.title: For Building Managers & Property Managers
buildingManagers.problem1Title: "How Do I Know This Contractor Actually Trains Their People?"
buildingManagers.problem1Desc: Any contractor can claim they have safety procedures. You have no way to verify whether employees actually review those procedures, or whether the contractor just has a dusty binder on a shelf somewhere. You're approving work based on promises, not evidence.
buildingManagers.solution1: Company Safety Rating (CSR) aggregates employee document acknowledgment rates into a visible score. You see ongoing engagement, not just claimed policies. High CSR means employees consistently acknowledge and review safety documentation.

businessImpact.description: Reduce el tiempo de preparacion de auditorias de horas a minutos.
businessImpact.paragraph1: Right now, your compliance exists in filing cabinets, desk drawers, and employee memories. You hope your technicians read the safety manual. You assume your Certificate of Insurance is current. You trust that everyone follows the same procedures they learned whenever they were last trained.
businessImpact.paragraph2: When nothing goes wrong, this works fine. When something goes wrong, it doesn't.
businessImpact.paragraph3: A WorkSafeBC auditor asks for proof that all employees reviewed your fall protection procedures. You spend an hour searching while technicians wait on standby. An insurance investigator requests documentation after an incident. You realize your COI expired three weeks ago. A lawsuit demands evidence that an employee was trained on the procedure they violated. You have nothing timestamped.
businessImpact.paragraph4: Document Management turns scattered compliance into professional infrastructure. Every document is centralized. Every signature is timestamped. Every acknowledgment is permanent. When you need proof, you generate a report.
businessImpact.paragraph5: Your technicians know which procedures apply to them. Your operations manager sees exactly who has gaps. Your auditors get instant answers. Your liability defense has documented evidence.
businessImpact.paragraph6: You're not just storing files. You're building a compliance history that protects your business.

faqs.title: Preguntas frecuentes

items.question: Que tipos de documentos puedo almacenar?
items.answer: Cualquier documento PDF, imagen o archivo de texto relacionado con seguridad, certificaciones o cumplimiento.

items.question: Cuanto tiempo se guardan los documentos?
items.answer: Los documentos se almacenan indefinidamente mientras tu cuenta este activa.

faqs.subtitle: Common questions about document management and compliance.

faq1.question: Can I edit or delete a signed document acknowledgment?
faq1.answer: No. Once a document acknowledgment is signed, the signature record is permanent and cannot be modified or deleted. This creates an immutable audit trail that protects both employers and employees. Regulators require tamper-proof documentation to verify compliance.

faq2.question: What happens when I update a document?
faq2.answer: When you upload a new version, the system creates a new document that requires fresh acknowledgments from all employees. Previous signatures remain associated with the previous version. This ensures employees always acknowledge the current procedure, not an outdated version.

faq3.question: Who can see my Certificate of Insurance?
faq3.answer: Only Company Owner and Ops Manager roles can view COI documents. Supervisors and Technicians cannot access these restricted financial documents. Insurance certificates contain sensitive financial information that should be limited to authorized personnel.

faq4.question: How do Safe Work Practices affect my CSR?
faq4.answer: Employee acknowledgment of daily safety practice topics contributes positively to your Company Safety Rating. Consistent engagement demonstrates an active safety culture. CSR rewards companies that don't just have safety documents but actively engage employees with safety topics.

faq5.question: Can building managers see my documents?
faq5.answer: Building managers cannot see your actual documents. They can see your CSR score, which reflects your overall safety compliance including document acknowledgment rates. This protects your proprietary procedures while giving building managers confidence in your safety practices.

faq6.question: What file types are supported?
faq6.answer: PDF, DOC, and DOCX files are supported for document uploads. File type validation ensures only appropriate formats are accepted.

faq7.question: What happens if an employee leaves?
faq7.answer: Their signature history remains in the system permanently. This maintains your audit trail even after employment ends. You can still prove that a former employee acknowledged specific procedures during their tenure.

faq8.question: How does this integrate with onboarding?
faq8.answer: New employees see all required documents highlighted for acknowledgment. Onboarding checklists can include document acknowledgment milestones. New hires cannot claim they missed required procedures because the system tracks completion status.

faq9.question: Can employees sign from mobile devices?
faq9.answer: Yes. Document review and digital signature capture work from any device. Technicians can acknowledge procedures from the field without returning to the office.

faq10.question: What's included in compliance reports?
faq10.answer: Reports show employee signature status by document, acknowledgment timestamps, missing signature alerts, and complete version history. Export as PDF for professional audit presentation or CSV for data analysis.

businessImpact.title: Impacto en el negocio
businessImpact.description: Reduce incidentes de equipo fallido a cero con inspecciones oportunas.
businessImpact.subtitle: Equipment management becomes something that happens, not something you do.
businessImpact.paragraph1: Right now, you're spending hours every month on equipment that should manage itself. Hunting for gear. Verifying availability. Documenting assignments. Replacing equipment you probably still own somewhere.
businessImpact.paragraph2: Your spreadsheet hasn't been updated in three months. Your techs take equipment without telling anyone. New hires get equipped with whatever you can find on short notice. And when gear goes missing, you eat the loss because you can't prove who had it.
businessImpact.paragraph3: With OnRopePro's Gear Inventory module, your employees build their own kits. They assign equipment to themselves, do their inspections, log their work. Every assignment creates a record. Every return updates availability. The system builds itself because everyone doing their job automatically feeds data into it.
businessImpact.paragraph4: You get complete visibility without the administrative burden. Know exactly what you own, where it is, and when it needs replacing. Accept jobs confidently. Budget accurately. Protect your investment.

q1.question: What if I have 10 harnesses but only registered 5 serial numbers?
q1.answer1: You still have 10 available slots. Serial numbers are optional metadata, not gatekeepers. The slot-based model counts quantity, not serial registrations.
q1.answer2: Add serials gradually as equipment is distributed.

q2.question: Can two different items have the same serial number?
q2.answer1: Yes. Serial numbers must be unique within each gear item type, but a harness and a rope can both have serial "HR-001." Different manufacturers use similar numbering schemes.
q2.answer2: The system prevents duplicates within an item type, which is what matters for tracking.

q3.question: What happens when equipment expires?
q3.answer1: The system tracks in-service dates with color-coded indicators for review. Hard gear (5 years) and soft gear (10 years) guidelines are displayed.
q3.answer2: You decide when to retire based on inspections and manufacturer recommendations. OnRopePro provides data for decision-making; actual retirement decisions should involve qualified safety professionals.

q4.question: Who can see equipment prices?
q4.answer1: Only users with financial permissions. Regular employees see quantities and assignments but not dollar values.
q4.answer2: Financial data is sensitive. Owners need it for budgeting and insurance. Employees don't need to know what their harness cost.

q5.question: Can I delete a serial number that's assigned to someone?
q5.answer1: No. Return the gear assignment first, then delete or edit the serial. This prevents orphaned assignments pointing to non-existent serials.
q5.answer2: Data integrity is maintained by enforcing proper return workflow.

q6.question: What if I need to reduce quantity below what's assigned?
q6.answer1: You cannot. If 5 items are assigned, you cannot reduce quantity below 5. Return some assignments first.
q6.answer2: This prevents negative availability and ensures the system always reflects physical reality.

q7.question: Do employees need permission to assign gear to themselves?
q7.answer1: No. All employees can self-assign from available inventory and remove their own assignments. No special permission required.
q7.answer2: This reduces administrative burden while maintaining complete tracking.

q8.question: How does equipment get added to inventory?
q8.answer1: Navigate to inventory, add item, select equipment type, pick brand and model from pre-loaded database, enter quantity.
q8.answer2: Optionally add serial numbers and assign to employees during the same workflow. One-time setup, then the system maintains itself.

q9.question: What's the difference between 'Manage Inventory' and 'Assign Gear' permissions?
q9.answer1: Manage Inventory allows adding new gear items, editing quantities, and registering serial numbers. Assign Gear allows distributing equipment to other employees.
q9.answer2: Owners have both. Supervisors might have Assign Gear without Manage Inventory, depending on your workflow.

q10.question: Can employees see what gear coworkers have?
q10.answer1: Only with View Team Gear permission. Otherwise, employees see only their own kit.
q10.answer2: Owners and supervisors typically have Team Gear visibility. Regular techs typically don't.

problem.title: El problema de nomina que nadie admite
problem.line1: Imprimes hojas de tiempo. Los datos de un empleado se extienden en cuatro paginas.
problem.line2: Doce empleados significa minimo 48 paginas. Las extiendes en tu escritorio, encierras horas con un boligrafo y tomas una calculadora.
problem.line3: Tres horas despues, aun no has terminado. Y probablemente cometiste un error que no descubriras hasta que el empleado llame preguntando por que le faltan $130.
problem.line4: Entonces envias una transferencia rapida. Problema resuelto para ellos. Problema creado para tus libros. Tu contador pregunta que fue ese pago aleatorio. Ahora estas explicando en lugar de dirigir tu empresa.
problem.line5: Este caos no se contiene. Cuando la nomina es dolorosa, la pospones. Cuando llegas tarde constantemente, tu equipo lo nota. Se forma una cultura donde los plazos son opcionales. Esa mentalidad se filtra en todo.
problem.solution: OnRopePro elimina la entrada manual entre el trabajo de campo y la nomina. Cada registro se convierte en datos de nomina automaticamente. Verificado por GPS. Atribuido al proyecto. Horas extras calculadas. Listo para exportar.

keyFeatures.title: Caracteristicas clave

feature1.title: Configuracion de periodos de pago
feature1.description: Elige periodos semanales, quincenales, semi-mensuales o mensuales. El sistema genera automaticamente los limites del periodo. Las sesiones de trabajo se agrupan en el periodo de pago correcto automaticamente.

feature2.title: Datos de tiempo verificados por GPS
feature2.description: Las horas provienen de sesiones de trabajo verificadas, no de libretas autoreportadas. La ubicacion del registro confirma que el tecnico realmente estaba en el sitio. Elimina disputas.

feature3.title: Reglas de horas extras configurables
feature3.description: Establece disparadores diarios (predeterminado 8 horas), disparadores semanales (predeterminado 40 horas) o umbrales personalizados. Los multiplicadores se ajustan de 1.5x a 3x. Desactiva las horas extras completamente si es necesario.

feature4.title: Atribucion de proyectos
feature4.description: Cada sesion de trabajo se vincula a un proyecto especifico. Tu vista de nomina muestra que edificio, que tipo de trabajo, cuantas horas. Esencial para el costeo de trabajos y la precision de futuras cotizaciones.

feature5.title: Seguimiento facturable vs no facturable
feature5.description: Distingue las horas de cliente que generan ingresos de los costos operativos. Viajes, mantenimiento de equipos, capacitacion, retrasos por clima. Conoce tu verdadero costo laboral.

feature6.title: Capacidades de exportacion
feature6.description: Exportacion CSV para integracion con software de nomina (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto). Reportes PDF de hojas de tiempo para registros. Detalle a nivel de empleado y desgloses de costos de proyecto disponibles.

results.title: Resultados medibles
results.subtitle: Mejoras concretas que veras desde el primer dia.

result1.title: Ahorro de tiempo
result1.description: El metodo manual de boligrafo y calculadora consume 6-10 horas por proceso de nomina. OnRopePro lo reduce a 30-45 minutos. Para nomina quincenal, eso es aproximadamente 260 horas ahorradas anualmente. Tiempo que vuelve a dirigir tu negocio.

result2.title: Reduccion de errores
result2.description: Sistemas conflictivos (libretas, relojes de tiempo, hojas de calculo) crean discrepancias. Datos de una sola fuente de verdad eliminan disputas de reconciliacion. Las correcciones caen dramaticamente cuando los datos son precisos desde el inicio.

result3.title: Precision en costeo de trabajos
result3.description: Sin atribucion de proyectos, no sabes por que los trabajos exceden el presupuesto. Con ella, ves exactamente donde fueron las horas. Los operadores reportan que la precision de cotizaciones mejora porque trabajan con datos historicos reales en lugar de estimaciones.

result4.title: Limpieza contable
result4.description: Los pagos de correccion aleatorios crean transacciones sin explicacion. Exportaciones limpias significan que cada dolar esta documentado antes de salir del sistema. El tiempo de reconciliacion del contador disminuye.

module4.description: Contexto de asignacion de turnos. Los turnos programados proporcionan horas esperadas para comparacion con las horas realmente trabajadas. Las discrepancias se vuelven visibles.

module5.description: Verificacion de elegibilidad para trabajo. Los requisitos de inspeccion de arnes y certificacion verifican antes de que se permita el registro. Las inspecciones fallidas bloquean las sesiones de trabajo.

module6.description: Los datos de nomina alimentan la analitica a nivel de empresa. Costos laborales, metricas de productividad y seguimiento de presupuesto derivan todos de la misma fuente de verdad.

impact.title: Deja de temer el dia de pago
impact.paragraph1: El dia de pago no deberia consumir tu tarde. No deberia involucrar una calculadora, un boligrafo y 48 paginas de impresiones extendidas en tu escritorio. Definitivamente no deberia resultar en transferencias aleatorias que confunden a tu contador y correcciones que toman mas tiempo que el procesamiento original.
impact.paragraph2: Ahora mismo, la nomina es probablemente la tarea mas odiada en tu calendario. La pospones. Llegas tarde. Tus empleados empiezan a presupuestar alrededor de "recibir pago tarde". Esa cultura de tardanza se filtra en todo lo demas.
impact.paragraph3: Cuando la nomina toma 30 minutos en lugar de 6 horas, dejas de evitarla. Cumples a tiempo. Tu equipo lo nota. Los estandares profesionales que estableces para la nomina se extienden a plazos de proyectos, comunicaciones con clientes y documentacion de seguridad.
impact.paragraph4: Recuperas mas de 260 horas al ano. Eso son seis semanas de trabajo completas. Tiempo actualmente gastado encerrar numeros que podria ir hacia cotizar nuevos contratos, gestionar relaciones con clientes, o simplemente estar presente para el trabajo que realmente quieres hacer.

faqs.title: Preguntas frecuentes
faqs.subtitle: Preguntas comunes sobre el modulo de Nomina y Finanzas.

faq1.question: OnRopePro calcula mis impuestos y deducciones?
faq1.answer: No. OnRopePro prepara datos de hojas de tiempo listos para nomina para exportar. Los calculos de nomina reales (CPP, EI, retencion de impuestos, Seguro Social, Medicare) se hacen en tu software de procesamiento de nomina (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto, etc.). OnRopePro maneja la agregacion de tiempo y exportacion, no el cumplimiento fiscal.

faq2.question: Que opciones de periodos de pago estan disponibles?
faq2.answer: Semanal, quincenal, semi-mensual y mensual. El sistema genera los limites del periodo automaticamente basado en tu seleccion.

faq3.question: Como funciona el calculo de horas extras?
faq3.answer: Configuras las reglas: disparador diario (predeterminado 8 horas), disparador semanal (predeterminado 40 horas) y multiplicador (1.5x, 2x, etc.). El sistema aplica estas reglas automaticamente a cada sesion de trabajo. Puedes desactivar las horas extras completamente si tu estructura de pago no las incluye.

faq4.question: Que formato usa la exportacion?
faq4.answer: CSV para importar a software de nomina. PDF para registros de hojas de tiempo imprimibles. Ambos incluyen detalle a nivel de empleado y atribucion de proyectos.

faq5.question: Quien puede ver los datos de nomina?
faq5.answer: Usuarios con el permiso canAccessFinancials. Esto se otorga a traves del sistema de permisos basado en roles. Los tecnicos ven sus propias horas pero no las tasas de compensacion ni los datos de otros empleados.

faq6.question: Que pasa si falta una sesion de trabajo o es incorrecta?
faq6.answer: Los supervisores con los permisos apropiados pueden revisar y ajustar sesiones de trabajo antes de la aprobacion de hojas de tiempo. Todos los ajustes se registran con razones para propositos de auditoria.

faq7.question: Puedo ver periodos de pago historicos?
faq7.answer: Si. Los periodos de pago anteriores permanecen accesibles. Filtra por rango de fechas para obtener datos de cualquier periodo pasado.

faq8.question: La atribucion de proyectos funciona si un tecnico trabaja en multiples edificios en un dia?
faq8.answer: Si. Cada sesion de trabajo se vincula a un proyecto especifico. Si un tecnico registra en el Edificio A por 4 horas, luego en el Edificio B por 4 horas, ambas sesiones aparecen separadamente con sus respectivas atribuciones de proyecto.

faq9.question: Que pasa con el tiempo no facturable como viajes entre sitios?
faq9.answer: Las sesiones de trabajo no facturables rastrean horas que no se pueden cobrar a clientes (viajes, capacitacion, mantenimiento de equipos, retrasos por clima). La vista de nomina muestra tanto horas facturables como no facturables para que conozcas tu verdadero costo laboral.

faq10.question: Hay un flujo de aprobacion antes de exportar?
faq10.answer: Si. Las hojas de tiempo pueden ser revisadas y aprobadas antes de exportar. Las hojas de tiempo aprobadas generan archivos de exportacion limpios. El flujo previene exportar datos que no han sido verificados.

owners.title: For Rope Access Company Owners
owners.problem1Title: "I didn't know his cert was expired until WorkSafeBC showed up."
owners.problem1Desc1: You're running busy season. Jobs stacked, crews deployed across multiple sites. Tracking when every technician's IRATA expires? It falls through the cracks. You assume they're handling their own renewals. Then WorkSafeBC arrives for a site inspection.
owners.problem1Desc2: OnRopePro monitors every certification with automated 30-day warnings and visual status indicators. One alert preventing one shutdown justifies years of subscription costs.
owners.problem2Desc1: Every new hire triggers the same dance. Email asking for info, wait, chase missing pieces, manually enter everything, email safety documents, wait for signatures, follow up again. Hours per employee.
owners.problem2Desc2: Two pathways eliminate this chaos. Existing OnRopePro user: enter IRATA number, they accept, done. 10 seconds. New user: they fill out their profile once on their own time. You just link them to your company.
owners.problem3Title: "My operations manager might be talking to competitors."
owners.problem3Desc1: You've given them broad access because they need it to do their job. Now you're suspicious. You can't fire without proof. You can't run operations without someone in that role.
owners.problem3Desc2: Granular permissions let you modify access in real-time without changing titles. Remove financial visibility, hide client information, restrict to basic functions. No formal demotion. No HR complications. Immediate protection.
owners.problem4Title: "One of my guys drove our truck for two months with an expired license."
owners.problem4Desc1: You check licenses at hiring. What happens six months later when they expire? You're not thinking about it. Neither are they. Then they're driving your vehicle without valid credentials.
owners.problem4Desc2: OnRopePro tracks driver's license expiration alongside certifications. Same 30-day warnings. Same visual indicators. Prevent one insurance claim denial or liability lawsuit and you've justified years of subscription.

opsManagers.title: For Operations Managers
opsManagers.problem1Title: "I can't remember who's certified for what."
opsManagers.problem1Desc1: You know Dave is Level 3 and pretty sure Mike is Level 2, but what about the new guys? When scheduling, you're doing mental gymnastics trying to remember who can lead, who needs supervision, who has working at heights training that's still valid.
opsManagers.problem1Desc2: Filter by certification level, check license status, see first aid expiration. The information exists where you're already making scheduling decisions.

technicians.title: For Technicians
technicians.problem1Title: "I have to fill out the same paperwork at every new employer."
technicians.problem1Desc1: Rope access has insane turnover. You might work for three companies in one season. Each one wants the same information: IRATA cert, void check, emergency contact, driver's license. You've filled this out a dozen times.
technicians.problem1Desc2: Create your OnRopePro profile once. When you join a new company, they enter your IRATA number, you accept, and everything transfers. Your certifications, contacts, banking info, work history. One profile, every employer.
technicians.problem2Title: "I never know if my certifications are about to expire."
technicians.problem2Desc1: You're focused on the job, not calendar dates. Your IRATA lapses, your first aid expires, and suddenly you can't work until you get recertified. Lost income. Scrambling to schedule training.
technicians.problem2Desc2: OnRopePro tracks your certification dates and alerts you before expiration. Proactive renewal instead of reactive scrambling.

faqs.title: Preguntas frecuentes

items.question: Como agrego un nuevo empleado?
items.answer: Ingresa su numero de certificacion IRATA/SPRAT y el sistema los vincula automaticamente.

items.question: Que sucede cuando un empleado se va?
items.answer: Su perfil permanece intacto y pueden conectarse con su proximo empleador.

faqs.subtitle: Common questions about the Employee Management module.

q1.question: Can technicians login with their IRATA number instead of email?
q1.answer: Yes. Technicians can log in using either their IRATA/SPRAT certification number or their email address. The certification number serves as a unique identifier across the platform.

q2.question: What happens when I hire a tech who already has an OnRopePro account?
q2.answer: Enter their IRATA/SPRAT number, send a connection request, and once they accept, their full profile transfers to your company. You only configure their compensation rate. All other information is already complete. Time required: 10 seconds (excluding their acceptance).

q3.question: Are role permissions predefined or do I have to set them up?
q3.answer: All roles except Company Owner start with zero permissions. You must explicitly grant each permission the employee needs. This prevents accidental over-permission and allows precise matching of access to job requirements and trust level.

q4.question: Does the system alert for driver's license expiration too?
q4.answer: Yes. Driver's license expiration dates are tracked and included in the same alert system as IRATA/SPRAT certifications. Visual indicators and notifications function identically.

q5.question: What happens to data when an employee is terminated?
q5.answer: The employee loses system access immediately, but all historical data is preserved. Work sessions, safety documents, equipment assignments, and payroll history remain in the system for compliance and audit purposes. This is a soft delete, not a hard delete.

q6.question: Can I use this for employees who aren't rope access technicians?
q6.answer: Yes. While certification tracking is designed for rope access (IRATA/SPRAT), the module supports roles like Labourer, Ground Crew, and general support staff who may not have rope access certifications. Leave certification fields empty for non-certified staff.

q7.question: What if I suspect an employee is sharing information with competitors?
q7.answer: Modify their permissions immediately. Remove financial access, hide client information, restrict to basic functions. No formal demotion required. Changes take effect instantly. Access modifications are logged for potential legal proceedings.

q8.question: Can employees see each other's pay rates?
q8.answer: Only if you grant them that specific permission. Financial visibility is separated from operational access. Your supervisor can create projects and check budgets without seeing what every technician earns.

q9.question: What certifications are tracked?
q9.answer: IRATA level and expiration, SPRAT certification, driver's license validity, and First Aid certification. All display visual status indicators (green/amber/red) and trigger 30-day warning alerts before expiration.

q10.question: How long does onboarding take for a completely new employee?
q10.answer: 5-10 minutes for data entry, excluding the time the employee spends setting up their own account. New employees receive login credentials via email and can then complete their profile details (emergency contacts, banking information) on their own time.

problem.intro: Friday afternoon. Golf tournament in an hour. You're throwing names right, left, and center to fill the spots for next week. Monday morning at 6am, your phone rings.

problem.cause: This happens because your project lives in one place, your calendar lives in another, and crew assignments live in a text thread. You create the window washing project. Then you open Float and recreate it. Name the project. Block the dates. Assign employees. Tag a color. Project gets pushed five days? Update both systems. Or forget to update one. And then watch the dominoes fall.
problem.solution: OnRopePro connects your projects directly to your schedule. Create a project with dates and assigned crew. The calendar populates automatically. Change the project dates and the schedule updates. Try to assign someone who's already booked elsewhere and the system warns you before you create the conflict. No more "Oh shit, I forgot to schedule that" emergencies.

problem.paragraph1: Un residente ve un problema. Le dicen al administrador del edificio. El administrador del edificio te envia un correo. Tu respondes. Ellos reenvian.

problem.scenario: A resident in unit 1247 emails about streaks on her window. A week later, she calls the building manager. The building manager calls you. You check your notebook. Maybe the email got lost. Maybe it didn't.
problem.waste: Now three people are spending time on something that might have been resolved in 10 minutes if anyone had known about it while the crew was still in the building.
problem.cost: That 10-minute fix? It becomes a half-day labor cost.
problem.returnVisit: Packing equipment, loading the van, driving across town, rigging ropes for one window, cleaning it, derigging, driving back. You've done the math. You know what those return visits cost.
problem.multiply: And that's just one complaint. During busy season, multiply it by buildings, by units, by the residents who give up entirely and complain on social media instead.
problem.solution: OnRopePro's Resident Portal puts feedback in front of your team while crews are still on-site. Residents submit issues with photos. Your supervisor sees a notification. The technician already rigged on that elevation flips their rope and checks the window. Problem solved in minutes, not days.

externalPortals.title: External Stakeholder Portals
externalPortals.intro: Three separate portals for three different needs.
externalPortals.description: Residents see their building's progress and submit feedback. Building managers see project details and response metrics. Property managers see portfolio-wide performance. No cross-contamination. No unauthorized access.
externalPortals.residentDesc: Progress visibility, feedback submission, photo documentation
externalPortals.buildingManagerDesc: Full project details, feedback management, work history
externalPortals.propertyManagerDesc: Multi-building oversight, vendor performance metrics, exportable reports

feedbackSystem.title: Centralized Feedback System
feedbackSystem.intro: Every resident complaint, compliment, and question flows into one dashboard.
feedbackSystem.description: No more texts to personal phones. No more emails lost in inboxes. No more sticky notes in the lobby. Timestamped. Photographed. Tracked from open to resolved.

upgrade.q: Puedo subir o bajar mi plan?
upgrade.a: Si! Cambia en cualquier momento. Los cambios toman efecto inmediatamente con ajustes de facturacion prorrateados.

setupFee.a: Sin tarifas de configuracion! Comienza con tu prueba gratuita de 60 dias para explorar todas las funciones.

trial.q: Que pasa despues de que termina mi prueba?
trial.a: Tus datos se guardan de forma segura. Suscribete para continuar o exporta tus datos en cualquier momento.

cancel.a: Si! Sin contratos ni compromisos. Cancela tu suscripcion en cualquier momento.
